Description: Four joining fragments of body of Attic red-figured pottery squat lekythos. Woman, holding a box in her outstretched hands, and dressed in chiton and himation, proceeds to right. The object at the right, although shown unconnected to it, may be an embroidered scarf hanging from the box. Below, the remains of an egg and dart border.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 105 no. 372 pl. 79)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1936)
